description: A legal document issued by a carrier to a shipper acknowledging receipt of cargo for shipment
notes: Serves as receipt, contract, and document of title

description: Non-negotiable document that covers goods transported by air
notes: Acts as a contract and proof of shipment

description: Issued by a freight forwarder to a shipper as part of consolidated cargo
notes: Represents the forwarder’s contract of carriage

description: Issued by the main carrier to the freight forwarder for consolidated cargo
notes: Shows details of multiple shipments under one master shipment

description: Lists goods sold and their value for customs and accounting
notes: Used for customs valuation and payment

description: Provides details of contents, dimensions, and weight of each package
Certifies the country where goods were manufactured
Preliminary bill of sale before goods are shipped
notes: Used to obtain import licenses or open L/Cs

description: Provides proof of cargo insurance coverage
notes: Needed for claims in case of loss or damage

description: Lists details of goods leaving the country for export
Filed by importer for customs clearance
notes: Used to calculate duties and taxes

description: Guarantees payment from buyer’s bank to seller
Confirms space reservation on a carrier
Authorizes release of goods to consignee
Certifies cargo containing hazardous materials
Provides specific instructions to freight forwarder
Details export package specifications
Comprehensive list of cargo loaded on a vessel or aircraft
Authorizes import of restricted goods
Authorizes export of controlled goods
Proof of cargo receipt by carrier
Instruction for release of goods after payment
Details freight and handling charges
notes: Used for payment of logistics costs

description: Used to declare goods to customs
Notifies consignee of cargo arrival
Confirms storage of goods at warehouse
Certifies gross and net weight of cargo
Confirms goods meet specified standards
Proves cargo was treated for pests
Certifies plant products are pest-free
Certifies food or animal products are safe
notes: Required for edible or live goods

description: Guides forwarder in preparing shipping documents
Accompanies goods during delivery
Records receipt of goods at destination
Details transport contract between sender and carrier
Documents handover of container between parties
Details goods transported by road
Describes chemical or physical properties of goods
Authorizes export of sensitive goods
Allows temporary import/export of goods without duties
Formal insurance contract for cargo
Proof that forwarder received cargo
notes: Used to issue Bill of Lading later

description: Provides estimated transport cost
Specialized invoice for international sales
Proof of customs duty payment
Certified by consulate of importing country
Details cargo stowage arrangement
Used for goods passing through a country
Classifies goods under export control rules
Specifies loading order and cargo details within container
Authorizes pickup of empty container
Details damage found on cargo during transit
Confirms goods inspected for quantity and quality
notes: May be required for L/C compliance

description: Official permission to import regulated goods
Details shipper’s instructions to forwarder
Describes placement of cargo on vessel
Declares cargo content for customs purposes
Lists all shipments under one consolidation
Government approval for export of specific goods
Authorizes release of goods from warehouse
